brief_summary.textblock:
Postoperative handovers to the post anaesthesia care unit (PACU) in adult anaesthesia are
      described as incomplete and unstructured, although their relevance for the patient safety is
      well known. It must be assumed that for children, this handover is at least comparable
      important.

      With a self-developed checklist information transfer during postoperative handovers will be
      documented and subsequently compared with patient information in anaesthesia records.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Handover to a Post Anaesthesia Care Unit in a Children's Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All patients transferred to the PACU after surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Age > 18 years

study_pop.textblock:
The study population consists of patients (<18 years of age) at Children's Hospital
        Cologne, being admitted to the main postoperative care unit (PACU), after they underwent
        interventions within normal surgery hours

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ministry of Work, Health and Social Affairs in North Rhine-Westph

primary_outcome.measure: Quantity of Information Loss during Postoperative Handovers in the PACU

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
